title: Articles for analytical pose estimation include the following. For pose estimation using four coplanar but not collinear feature points, see “Random Sample Consensus: A Paradigm for Model Fitting with Applications to Image Analysis and Automated Cartography
If camera intrinsic parameters need to be estimated, six or more feature points will be required for a unique solution

container-title: by S. Ganapathy, in Pattern Recog. Lett
title: Matrices for Robot Vision
See also “Analysis and Solutions of the Three Point Perspective Pose Estimation Problem
and “An Analytic Solution for the Perspective 4-Point Problem

container-title: IEEE Trans. Pat. Anal. Machine Intell
note: by R. Goldberg, in Int. J. Comput.
title: The articles for the least-squares solutions in pose estimation include an article by S
mentioned above, and “Determination of Camera Location from 2-D to 3-D Line and Point Correspondences
Also, “Constrained Pose Refinement of Parametric Objects

note: by C. P. Lu and G. D.
title: A fast and globally convergent orthogonal iteration (OI) algorithm is introduced in “Fast and Globally Convergent Pose Estimation from Video Images

container-title: IEEE Trans. Patt. Analysis and Machine Intell
note: by B. Espiau, F. Chaumette, and P. Rives, in
publisher: Dept. of Electrical and Computer Engineering, Carnegie Mellon University
title: The following references provide solutions to online estimation of depth information and image Jacobian matrix for IBVS. “Manipulator Control with Image-Based Visual Servo
provides an explicit depth estimation based on the feature analysis. An adaptive control-based method for depth estimation is provided in “Controlled Active Vision
It is also proposed to use an approximation to the value of the image Jacobian matrix computed at the desired camera position, in “A New Approach to Visual Servoing in Robotics

publisher: Dept. of Electrical and Computer Engineering, Carnegie Mellon University
title: There are different image Jacobian derived in the literature. The following sources could be studied for further details
and “Vision Resolvability for Visually Servoed Manipulation,’
Also see “Controlled Active Vision

note: by B. Espiau et al., mentioned above. Also see Malis et al. [1999] for Jacobian matrix for 2-1/2D servoing.
title: Other forms of image Jacobian matrices have been derived using geometrical entities, such as spheres and lines, are also available in: “A New Approach to Visual Servoing in Robotics

The journal IEEE Transactions on Robotics and Automation reports advances in robot programming and practical computer vision

container-title: IEEE Transactions on Electronic Packaging Manufacturing, IEEE Transactions on Robotics and Automation, and IEEE/ASME Journal on Microelectromechanical Systems. Conferences that maintain a large focus on microassembly include the International Workshop on Microfactories (IWMF), held in even years in the fall, and the annual SPIE Microrobotics and Microassembly conference series, held annually in conjunction with the SPIE Photonics East in the fall. Sessions on microassembly often appear at the annual IEEE International Conference on Robotics and Automation (ICRA) and the IEEE/RSJ International Conference on Intelligent Robots and Systems (IROS
title: For Further Information Several journals publish research related to microassembly, including the Journal of Micromechatronics
